instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: don't boot 820-2530
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board 820-2530 with green led when i plug the magsafe adapter but when i push the button on, nothing, same with the pad on the board.
I have the 3,35 on the pad. I look on the scope no trace of liquid.
What can i check? 
thanks

threads.title: don't boot 820-2530
threads.message: No C7771 on a 2530. Need the basics, PPBUS, 3V3_S5?

threads.title: don't boot 820-2530
threads.message:
Hi,
I make the measure:
PPBUS_G3H on F7000=12,58V
PP3V3_S5 on Q7930=3,338V
I check C7771 on the board i find it, in diode mode 0,3, PP1V1R1V05_S5=1,060V
Thanks

threads.title: don't boot 820-2530
threads.message: Do you have any idea? what can i check?

threads.title: don't boot 820-2530
threads.message:
Resistance to ground at L6995, on 200K scale?
If lower than 30K, possible bad MCP.
MCP's RTC signals OK?
C7771 doesn't fail on this board (as duke already said).
But its MCP is now so old...

threads.title: don't boot 820-2530
threads.message:
Ok i measure the L6995 = 5,212K
MCP RTC signal is 32.768
MCP clock 25MHZ is good too.
You think it's bad MCP?
thanks

threads.title: don't boot 820-2530
threads.message:
5.2K sounds like bad MCP...
I saw another thread with similar value.
